org.itemscript.core.values
Interface JsonArray

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<JsonValue>, HasSystem, java.lang.Iterable<JsonValue>, JsonAccess, JsonContainer, JsonValue, java.util.List<JsonValue>
public interface JsonArray
extends JsonContainer, java.util.List<JsonValue>

Represents a JSON array value.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

a

JsonArray a(java.lang.Boolean value)
Add a boolean value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array.

Parameters:
value - The boolean value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

a

JsonArray a(byte[] value)
Add a binary value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
value - The binary value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

Returns:
This JsonArray object.

a

JsonArray a(java.lang.Long value)
Add a long value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array. Note that because JSON numbers cannot safely contain a long value, longs are stored in JSON string values.

Parameters:
value - The long value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

a

Returns:
This JsonArray object.

getArray

JsonArray getArray(int index)
Get a JsonArray from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonArray at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonArray.

getBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getBoolean(int index)
Get a boolean value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The boolean value of the JsonBoolean at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonBoolean.

getInt

java.lang.Integer getInt(int index)
Get an integer value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The int value of the JsonNumber at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonNumber.

getLong

java.lang.Long getLong(int index)
Get a long value from this array. Note that because JSON numbers cannot safely contain a long value, longs are stored in JSON string values. If the value does not exist or is not a string, returns null. If the value is a string but it cannot be parsed as a long, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The long value of the JsonString at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonString.

getObject

JsonObject getObject(int index)
Get a JsonObject from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonObject value at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonObject.

getString

java.lang.String getString(int index)
Get a string value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The string value of the JsonString at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonString.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
index - The index to set at.
value - The binary value to set.
